lines.gurmukhi: jYsy cUno KwNf sÍyq eyksy idKweI dyq pweIAY qO sÍwd rs rsnw kY cwKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Choono Khaand Svayt Aykasay Dikhaaee Dayta , Paaeeai Tau Svaad Ras Rasanaa Kai Chaakheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as both sugar and flour being white look alike, but can only be identified when tasted (one is sweet, the other insipid).

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy pIq brn hI hym Ar pIqr hÍY jwnIAY mhq pwrKd AgR rwKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Peet Baran Hee Haym Ar Peetar Hvai , Jaaneeai Mahat Paarakhad Agr Raakheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as brass and gold bear the same colour, but when both are placed before an examiner, the value .of gold is known.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kaUAw koiklw hY dono Kg sRXwm qn bUJIAY AsuB suB sbd su BwKIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kaooaa Kokilaa Hai Dono Khag Syaam Tana , Boojheeai Asoubh Soubh Sabad Su Bhaakheeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as both a crow and a cuckoo is black in colour, but they can be distinguished by their voice. (One is sweet to the ears while the other is noisy and irritating).

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI AswD swD ichn kY smwn hoq krnI krqUq lg lCn kY lwKIAY ]596]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Asaadh Saadh Chihan Kai Samaan Hota , Karanee Karatoot Lag Lachhan Kai Laakheeai ?596?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, outer signs of a real and a fake saint look alike but their actions and characteristics can reveal who is genuine among them. (Only then can one know who is good and who is bad).  (596)
